header.title: Frequently Asked Questions
header.description: Find answers to the most common questions about MobiFit.

questions.question: What is MobiFit?
questions.answer: MobiFit is a SuperApp for workouts with videos and guidance created by professionals. You can build your own workouts, use ready-made ones, receive workouts from a personal trainer, or let the artificial intelligence create a plan for you. The app also includes gamification features such as points, badges and groups to join challenges and interact with others.

questions.question: Which languages is the app available in?
questions.answer: MobiFit is available in three languages: English, Portuguese and Spanish.

questions.question: Do I need to create an account to use the app?
questions.answer: No, an account is not required for workouts. You can start using most features without logging in. Authentication is only required for features like groups and cloud data synchronization.

questions.question: Does the app work offline?
questions.answer: Yes. Data is stored locally on the device, allowing you to use the exercise library, workouts, track progress and access your points even without an internet connection. Media such as images and exercise videos are available offline only if they have been viewed previously.

questions.question: How does the AI work in MobiFit?
questions.answer: The AI generates personalized training plans from your request, answers exercise questions, and offers adaptations based on your level, goals, or available equipment. It also learns your level and preferences over time, improving its suggestions.

questions.question: Do I need to know how to create prompts to use the AI?
questions.answer: No. The app includes an option called "Create Workout" that collects your preferences and automatically generates the ideal request for you.

questions.question: Are the videos generated by AI?
questions.answer: No. All videos and instructions were created by human professionals. They are meant to illustrate movements and may show equipment different from what is listed in the exercise title.

questions.question: What is the difference between the "MobiFit Workouts" and "My Workouts" menus?
questions.answer: MobiFit Workouts are ready-made workouts created by professionals specifically for the app, organized by difficulty level and generic use. "My Workouts" are user-specific: they can be created manually, generated by the AI, or received from others like friends and trainers.

questions.question: How is a workout structured?
questions.answer: The hierarchy is: Plan → Workouts → Exercises. A plan groups several workouts, and each workout contains a sequence of specific exercises.

questions.question: Can I create my own exercises?
questions.answer: Yes. You can create custom exercises with a name, description, YouTube video URL and your own image. Uploading images requires you to be logged in.

questions.question: How do I share a workout with someone?
questions.answer: To share a workout both users must be in the same group. You can share it directly with a specific person in the group or make the workout available to all group members.

questions.question: When should I use "Log Activity"?
questions.answer: Use Log Activity when you perform exercises that are not available in your saved Workouts. At the end you can optionally share the activity in a MobiFit group and/or on Instagram Stories.

questions.question: What are Goals?
questions.answer: Goals are personal and have a duration you define. Check-ins are recorded when you mark a workout as completed or manually in the "Goals" menu.

questions.question: Do I need to be logged in to join groups?
questions.answer: Yes. The groups feature requires authentication.

questions.question: How do I join a group?
questions.answer: You can click the invitation link you received or use the "join a group" option and enter the provided code.

questions.question: What can administrators do in groups?
questions.answer: Administrators can manage members, view submitted anamneses and share workouts with the entire group.

questions.question: What are Challenges?
questions.answer: Challenges are group-based and use posts for check-ins. They can have a defined period or be ongoing.

questions.question: How does the challenge check-in system work?
questions.answer: You can check in in two ways: by posting directly to the group feed or by sharing a completed workout to the group. Each post counts as a check-in.

questions.question: How is the challenge ranking calculated?
questions.answer: The ranking can be viewed by "active days" or "total check-ins". If you make two posts on the same day, that counts as two check-ins but only one active day.

questions.question: How do I create and configure challenges to engage students?
questions.answer: As a group administrator, go to settings and enable the challenge option. Set the start and end dates for the period you want to track. You can also require a photo for posts, which forces participants to include an image in their check-ins and increases commitment.

questions.question: How do coins work?
questions.answer: Almost every relevant action in the app earns coins, which encourages engagement and consistency in workouts.

questions.question: What are badges?
questions.answer: Badges mark specific achievements, such as starting a goal, joining a group, or completing certain milestones.

questions.question: Is there a ranking in the app?
questions.answer: Yes. Group challenges include a ranking system based on members' check-ins, which can be filtered by different time periods.

questions.question: Can I share my full workout on social networks?
questions.answer: Yes. When you finish a workout or log an activity, you can post it to the internal group and also to Instagram Stories, with options for custom stickers.

questions.question: How does photo sharing work?
questions.answer: The sharing modal lets you take photos or choose from the gallery. You can post only to the MobiFit group, to Instagram Stories, or to both. Vertical photos are automatically cropped to 4:5 for the group feed, while Instagram Stories remain uncropped. The app shows the crop at capture time.

questions.question: Will my data be saved if I don't create an account?
questions.answer: Yes. Data remains stored locally on your device. However, without logging in it won't be synced to the cloud and may be lost if you uninstall the app or lose your device.

questions.question: How can MobiFit help me work with my students?
questions.answer: The app offers professional features: you can create private groups for your students, share personalized workouts, monitor engagement through challenges, and receive anamnesis information in an organized and private way.

questions.question: How does sharing workouts with students work?
questions.answer: You can share a personalized workout with all members of a group or send it directly to a specific student. When shared with a group, the workout appears in the group's "Workouts" menu and each student can add it manually to their "My Workouts" list. If sent directly to a student, it appears automatically in their app under "My Workouts" in the "Content" tab.

questions.question: Do I need to be in the same group as my student to share workouts?
questions.answer: Yes. All interactive features use groups. Workout sharing is only possible between people in the same group. Create a group, send the invite link to your students, and once they join you can share workouts.

questions.question: What is an anamnesis and how do I use it with my students?
questions.answer: An anamnesis is a space where your students can submit personal information relevant to their follow-up. This data is visible only to group administrators, allowing you to keep an organized history for each student, including health information, goals, limitations and other notes important for workout prescription.

questions.question: How do I track students' performance in challenges?
questions.answer: In the group's ranking menu you can view all members' participation. The system allows switching between views by active days or total check-ins, and filtering by different periods: current week, month, year or all time. A progress bar shows the challenge's progress relative to the defined period.

questions.question: Can I have multiple groups for different classes of students?
questions.answer: Yes. You can create and manage multiple groups, each with its own settings, challenges and shared workouts.
